CHANGES TO SAFETY
United Ethanol, LLC developed a set of procedures, as part of the Management of Change system, to identify and determine if major modifications are conducted properly, and to ensure that employees are notified about and understand the ramifications of these changes. 


INTEGRITY
United Ethanol, LLC has completed its 10-year non-destructive testing for all of its Process Safety Management (PSM) system requirements.

Executive Summary of Risk Management Plan for:
United Ethanol, LLC
Milton, WI

INTRODUCTION:
United Ethanol, LLC (United Ethanol) has constructed and is operating a fuel grade ethanol production facility in Milton, Wisconsin.  It produces fuel-grade ethanol from corn through a fermentation process.  The spent grains, or Distillers Dried Grains and Solubles, is sold as animal feed and a portion of the carbon dioxide generated during fermentation also recovered and sold.

United Ethanol, LLC is required by law to denature its ethanol product prior to shipment.  A liquid petroleum based blend is used which includes three regulated flammable substances; pentane, isopentane and butane.  The denaturant is stored in an outdoor, 2,031 barrel (85,000 gallon) storage tank surrounded by a foot high secondary containment dike. 
Denaturant is also present in rail tanker cars that have been loaded with blended ethanol and denaturant awaiting shipment by the rail carrier.
RELEASE PREVENTION RESPONSE POLICY
United Ethanol, LLC is committed to managing the facility in accordance with relevant regulations and good manufacturing practices to minimize the risk of an accidental release of a regulated substance from the storage tank and loading process. If an accidental release was to occur, United Ethanol, LLC has response measures in place to minimize the impact of the release.  

WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIOS
In assessing the ramifications of a worst case release scenario, United Ethanol, LLC employed the latest available version of RMP*COMP software.  The objective was to estimate the distance to the flammable endpoint for a mixture containing the regulated organics pentane, isopentane and butane.  Data for the model was supplied by the Safety Data Sheets from our vendor.  It was the source for physical data such as liquid density and concentrations of the three qualified components.
